Creating networks in [Cystoscape](https://cytoscape.org/)

The following example shows how to use Cytoscape (v3.7.2) to create publication ready networks from assets calculated in DAVe. This example will use two components the `r dcr_gr( 'edge_list')` and the `r dcr_gr( 'node_data')` files.

`r dcr_gr( 'edge_list.csv')`

<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/edge_list.png"))
```
</div>


`r dcr_gr( 'node_data.csv')`

<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/node_data.png"))
```
</div>


### Upload `r dcr_gr( 'edge_list')` 

In cytoscape select `r dcr_gr( 'File')` >> `r dcr_gr( 'Import')` >> `r dcr_gr( 'network from File Upload')`  and then select the `r dcr_gr( 'edge_list.csv')` file.

<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/cy1.png"))
```
</div>


### Set from and to columns 
<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/cy2.png"))
```
</div>

### `r dcr_gr( 'from')` set to `r dcr_gr( 'Source Node')` 
<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/cy3.png"))
```
</div>

### `r dcr_gr( 'to')` set to `r dcr_gr( 'Target Node')` 
<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/cy4.png"))
```
</div>


Select `r dcr_gr( 'OK')` once the source and target columns are identified.

### Overview network
<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/cy5.png"))
```
</div>

### Upload `r dcr_gr( 'node _data')`. Select `r dcr_gr( 'File')` >> `r dcr_gr( 'Import')` >> `r dcr_gr( 'Table from File')`

<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/cy6.png"))
```
</div>

### Select the `r dcr_gr( 'ID')` column as the variable `r dcr_gr( 'Key')`
<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/cy7.png"))
```
</div>

### The uploaded node attributes should now be available to edit the network node and edge visual properties.
<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/cy8.png"))
```
</div>

### Specify the node and edge visual properties. 
<div class='bordered'>
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics(normalizePath("../img/dave.network/cytoscape/cy9.png"))
```
</div>

### Take a look at the example `r dcr_gr( 'cytoscape.cys')` file for how each of the data columns were mapped to the network.
